metadata.synopsis: Orpheus is now freed from the player's assistance. They now have the option to take the Mind Flayer form, or to give Orpheus that responsibility. He is not really impressed with the tadpole in the player's head. It's possible the player would have fought Orpheus in Intermezzo before this point, so there should be some reactivity to it.
metadata.how_to_trigger: oe end_startillithidoptionsFinish dialogAttack the emperorTalk to Raphael to get the hammerBreak crystals with hammer to free Orpheusor oe end_freeorpheus

76.speaker: Orpheus
76.context: NodeContext: Mind flayer - abomination to Vlaakith!

20.speaker: Orpheus
20.text: You. Ghaik. Ally of my abuser. You will face my retribution.
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus, freed, takes his shortsword out of the rock nearby and wields it, threateningly, ready to strike.

91.speaker: Narrator
91.text: *As the githyanki prince takes his blade, a silent cry pierces your head. It's unlike any sensation you've ever felt.*
91.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus, freed, takes his shortsword out of the rock nearby and wields it, threateningly, ready to strike.

199.speaker: Orpheus
199.text: You attempted to obliterate my mind for your own gain.

62.speaker: Orpheus
62.text: You felled a githyanki ally as they attempted to defend me.
62.context: NodeContext: shocked to hear the player express emotion in a natural and sincere way

399.speaker: Orpheus
399.text: And yet you freed me, and stand before me now - a living contradiction.
399.context: NodeContext: shocked to hear the player express emotion in a natural and sincere way

32.speaker: Orpheus
32.text: What have you to say for yourself? Speak!
32.context: NodeContext: shocked to hear the player express emotion in a natural and sincere way

467.speaker: Player
467.text: It's Lae'zel's word that's kept you from losing your mind, so show some gratitude.
467.context: NodeContext: shocked to hear the player express emotion in a natural and sincere way

294.speaker: Player
294.text: Lae'zel's death was regrettable. But there will be many more if you don't help us defeat the Netherbrain.
294.context: NodeContext: shocked to hear the player express emotion in a natural and sincere way

37.speaker: Orpheus
37.context: NodeContext: shocked to hear the player express emotion in a natural and sincere way

70.speaker: Orpheus
70.context: NodeContext: shocked to hear the player express emotion in a natural and sincere way

240.speaker: Narrator
240.text: *His eyes search your ally, interrogating it for signs of genuine emotion - and finds it.*
240.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus glares at the party mind flayer.

61.text: What did I expect? It is in your very nature to say whatever you think I need to hear to forgo your slaughter.
61.context: NodeContext: muttering to himself, remembering that mind flayers are masters of manipulation

329.speaker: Orpheus
329.text: What did I expect? It is in your very nature to say whatever you think I need to hear to forgo your slaughter.
329.context: NodeContext: muttering to himself, remembering that mind flayers are masters of manipulation

217.speaker: Orpheus
217.text: You have spent too long with this ghaik. You think you can manipulate me.
217.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressing the player mind flayer

137.speaker: Orpheus
137.text: Your pretty words may have swayed others, ghaik, but they will not sway me.
137.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressing the player mind flayer

2.speaker: Orpheus
2.text: You are a blight on this world. And I will remove you from it. Htak'a!

477.speaker: Player
477.text: Yet here you stand, alive and still in control of your own mind. We have bigger problems now.
477.context: NodeContext: contemplative and surprised - it's as though you are friends with pure evil but he realises you're still good

109.speaker: Player
109.text: I don't need to justify my actions to you. I have a Netherbrain to kill, and I will do it by any means necessary.
109.context: NodeContext: contemplative and surprised - it's as though you are friends with pure evil but he realises you're still good

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I don't need to justify my actions to you. I have a Netherbrain to kill, and I will do it by any means necessary.
69.context: NodeContext: contemplative and surprised - it's as though you are friends with pure evil but he realises you're still good

502.speaker: Orpheus
502.text: You stand with a ghaik. And yet your mind remains your own...
502.context: NodeContext: contemplative and surprised - it's as though you are friends with pure evil but he realises you're still good

282.speaker: Orpheus
282.text: You stand with a ghaik. And yet your mind remains your own...
282.context: NodeContext: contemplative and surprised - it's as though you are friends with pure evil but he realises you're still good

1.text: In all my years, I never thought I'd see a ghaik that would pretend to oppose its elder brain as a means to ensure its own survival.
1.context: NodeContext: sad for the player, who he now sees as infinitely pitiable

272.speaker: Orpheus
272.text: In all my years, I never thought I'd see a ghaik that would pretend to oppose its elder brain as a means to ensure its own survival.
272.context: NodeContext: sad for the player, who he now sees as infinitely pitiable

244.speaker: Orpheus
244.text: I knew your kind lacked honour, but this... this is ignomy beyond words.

0.speaker: Orpheus
0.text: You have spent too long with this ghaik. You have lost all honour. All sense.
0.context: NodeContext: sad for the player, who he now sees as infinitely pitiable

316.speaker: Orpheus
316.text: You are its thrall. But worry not - I will save you from this fate. I will give you the release of death.
316.context: NodeContext: genuinely believes he's doing the player a favour by killing them

425.speaker: Player
425.text: Lae'zel had no intention of letting you live. She was an agent of Vlaakith.
425.context: NodeContext: considering the possibility that a mind flayer saved him from one of his own (a githyanki), someone he should have been able to trust that would have stabbed him in the back

211.text: Then you protected me... and in so doing, eliminated a heretic.
211.context: NodeContext: considering the possibility that a mind flayer saved him from one of his own (a githyanki), someone he should have been able to trust that would have stabbed him in the back

326.speaker: Orpheus
326.text: Then you protected me... and in so doing, eliminated a heretic.
326.context: NodeContext: considering the possibility that a mind flayer saved him from one of his own (a githyanki), someone he should have been able to trust that would have stabbed him in the back

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I'm here to finish what I started - your assimilation.

325.speaker: Orpheus
325.text: You felled a fellow soldier as they attempted to defend me.

250.speaker: Orpheus
250.text: Your ghaik attempted to assimilate me.

499.speaker: Orpheus
499.text: Under your watch, it almost succeeded.

191.speaker: Lae'zel
191.text: Orpheus - son of Gith, heir of All Skies. We do not come to slay you; we come to restore you.
191.context: NodeContext: tsk-VAH (shit) / gayk (with a slight guttural sound to it)

158.speaker: Orpheus
158.text: Tsk'va. Your words mean nothing to me, ghaik.
158.context: NodeContext: tsk-VAH (shit) / gayk (with a slight guttural sound to it)

268.speaker: Orpheus
268.text: Hshar'lak. You consort with ghaik. Your words mean nothing to me.
268.context: NodeContext: h-SHAR-lak (traitor) / gayk (with a slight guttural sound to it)

420.speaker: Player
420.text: You should show some gratitude - I am your liberator.

472.speaker: Player
472.text: I did not come to slay you; I'm here to restore you Orpheus, heir of All Skies.

461.speaker: Player
461.text: We don't have time for revenge. We have bigger problems.

416.speaker: Orpheus
416.text: Why do you seek to reason with me?

311.speaker: Orpheus
311.text: You liberated me only when it suited you.

469.speaker: Orpheus
469.text: And you are a friend of ghaik.

305.speaker: Player
305.text: Stay your weapon - I'm the mind flayer who's going to save us all.

436.speaker: Orpheus
436.text: You slaughtered my honour guard. You abused my power.

147.speaker: Orpheus
147.text: You are no salvation. You are an abomination.

299.speaker: Orpheus
299.text: At best you intend to kill me. At worst - you wish to make me just like you.

353.speaker: Player
353.text: Not all mind flayers are alike. This one has free will.

335.speaker: Player
335.text: It doesn't want to kill you. It wants your help.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Wait - we can work together. The mind flayer and I want the same thing as you.

125.speaker: Orpheus
125.text: A mind flayer in possession of its mental faculties?
125.context: NodeContext: 'Mother Gith' spoken as a curse under the breath - like 'Mother fucker...'

44.speaker: Orpheus
44.text: This is the stuff of fables.
44.context: NodeContext: 'Mother Gith' spoken as a curse under the breath - like 'Mother fucker...'

53.speaker: Orpheus
53.text: It is as if I am reliving the legend of Oryndoll.

352.speaker: Orpheus
352.text: You are the illithid Urengol, rebelling against your own hivemind. And I am the noble githyanki Valraag who must now reconsider his position.

177.speaker: Orpheus
177.text: An illithid capable of rebelling against the Netherbrain's instruction... Not only capable, but willing...

309.speaker: Orpheus
309.text: If your intentions are as righteous as they seem, then this is an advantage I cannot overlook. An advantage that must be grasped, for our enemy is formidable indeed.

361.text: Very well, scion of Vlaakith. I propose an alliance - for the sake of all our people. For the sake of ending the Grand Design.

115.speaker: Orpheus
115.text: Very well, scion of Vlaakith. I propose an alliance - for the sake of all our people. For the sake of ending the Grand Design.
115.context: InternalNodeContext: This is for the edge-cse that Orpheus Path Companion Lae'zel was made the main speaker.

19.speaker: Orpheus
19.text: Very well. I propose an alliance.
19.context: InternalNodeContext: This is for the edge-cse that Orpheus Path Companion Lae'zel was made the main speaker.

71.speaker: Orpheus
71.text: It would be my honour to call you an ally, Your Majesty.
71.context: InternalNodeContext: This is for the edge-cse that Orpheus Path Companion Lae'zel was made the main speaker.

366.speaker: Player
366.text: It would be my honour to call you an ally, Your Majesty.

260.speaker: Player
260.text: I've been through much to get here. Put truth to our fables, Orpheus. Lead the way.

393.speaker: Player
393.text: And if I were to say no?

536.speaker: Lae'zel
536.text: He must be consumed. Vlaakith's will above all.

494.speaker: Lae'zel
494.text: You would ally with the seditious prince? Tsk'va!

293.speaker: Lae'zel
293.text: You transformed to ghaik, and still leave this wretched traitor breathing?

41.speaker: Lae'zel
41.text: An ally transformed to ghaik, and you still leave this wretched traitor breathing?

108.speaker: Player
108.text: It would be my honour to call you an ally, Your Majesty.
108.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

57.speaker: Player
57.text: I have no interest in allying myself with you, Orpheus.
57.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

288.speaker: Orpheus
288.text: We share an enemy, we share a cause. The foe we face is formidable.

427.speaker: Orpheus
427.text: If there is to be a tomorrow, today we must be allies.

482.speaker: Player
482.text: I'm sorry, my prince. But I must assimilate you.
482.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Enough. In the name of Vlaakith, I will consume the Prince of the Comet!
12.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

347.speaker: Player
347.text: Enough said. Devour his brain to assimilate his knowledge.
347.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

229.speaker: Lae'zel
229.text: Traitor. By the sacred silver, I'll make this prison your grave.
229.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

431.speaker: Lae'zel
431.text: No! By the sacred silver, I'll make this prison your grave.
431.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

519.text: *You feel sated. More than sated - complete. And ready to face the Netherbrain.*
519.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Same as in END_IllithidOptions_Assimilation

The Player (as a mind flayer) wraps their tentacles around Orpheus' face and brings their mouth over Orpheus' head. 
Player feeds CLUMSILY. Suckling noises.
Orpheus' eyes dart around in pain as his brain is consumed.
Once it's done, Orpheus' head flops to the side, his head empty.

500.speaker: Narrator
500.text: *You feel sated. More than sated - complete. And ready to face the Netherbrain.*

484.speaker: Lae'zel
484.text: The traitor prince is dead, and we carry his power. Vlaakith gha'g shkath zai!

103.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player waves a hand, and opens a portal, ready for the party to leave.

162.speaker: Player
162.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Same as in END_IllithidOptions_Assimilation

The Player who is a mind flayer wraps their tentacles around Orpheus' face and brings their mouth over Orpheus' head. 
Player feeds CLUMSILY. Suckling noises.
Orpheus' eyes dart around in pain as his brain is consumed.
Once it's done, Orpheus' head flops to the side, his head empty.

52.speaker: Lae'zel
52.text: Yes. Devour the traitor, my queen be praised!
52.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Same as in END_IllithidOptions_Assimilation

The Player who is a mind flayer wraps their tentacles around Orpheus' face and brings their mouth over Orpheus' head. 
Player feeds CLUMSILY. Suckling noises.
Orpheus' eyes dart around in pain as his brain is consumed.
Once it's done, Orpheus' head flops to the side, his head empty.

407.speaker: Orpheus
407.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Same as in END_IllithidOptions_Assimilation

The Player who is a mind flayer wraps their tentacles around Orpheus' face and brings their mouth over Orpheus' head. 
Player feeds CLUMSILY. Suckling noises.
Orpheus' eyes dart around in pain as his brain is consumed.
Once it's done, Orpheus' head flops to the side, his head empty.

150.text: *Even at a distance you feel it - satisfaction. The feeding has nourished you - you are ready to face the Netherbrain again.*
150.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Same as in END_IllithidOptions_Assimilation

The Player who is a mind flayer wraps their tentacles around Orpheus' face and brings their mouth over Orpheus' head. 
Player feeds CLUMSILY. Suckling noises.
Orpheus' eyes dart around in pain as his brain is consumed.
Once it's done, Orpheus' head flops to the side, his head empty.

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *Even at a distance you feel it - satisfaction. The feeding has nourished you - you are ready to face the Netherbrain again.*
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindflayer player waves a hand, and opens a portal, ready for the party to leave.

527.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindflayer player waves a hand, and opens a portal, ready for the party to leave.

230.speaker: Player
230.text: There will be no tomorrow. You will die now, Orpheus.

248.speaker: Player
248.text: The mind flayer wants the same thing as us - to kill the Netherbrain.

209.speaker: Player
209.text: It's simpler than that, my mind flayer friends needs to feed for the fight ahead.

359.speaker: Orpheus
359.text: In order to overthrow your own hivemind...

155.speaker: Orpheus
155.text: Your ghaik friend is no ally - they are an abomination.

437.speaker: Player
437.text: Stay your weapon - the mind flayer is my ally, and will save us all.

349.speaker: Player
349.text: The vaunted son of Gith, trembling at the sight of a single ghaik.

458.speaker: Orpheus
458.text: You still stand for Vlaakith? Can it be - a mind flayer in possession of its mental faculties?

430.speaker: Lae'zel
430.text: Traitor prince. I am not intimidated by your blade.
430.context: NodeContext: gayk (with a slight guttural sound to it)

99.speaker: Orpheus
99.text: Then you will be at peace when you taste it.
99.context: NodeContext: gayk (with a slight guttural sound to it)

79.speaker: Orpheus
79.text: Go. The longer we wait, the more the Netherbrain's strength grows.
79.context: InternalNodeContext: Player would have chosen they they or Karlach would take resposibility to transform if they betrayed Vlaakith Lae'zel, so this branch should continue on that logic.

94.speaker: Orpheus
94.text: Please tell me you have ceased your dithering and decided to transform?
94.context: InternalNodeContext: Player would have chosen they they or Karlach would take resposibility to transform if they betrayed Vlaakith Lae'zel, so this branch should continue on that logic.

123.speaker: Orpheus
123.text: Vlaakith never had a better disciple.
123.context: InternalNodeContext: Player would have chosen they they or Karlach would take resposibility to transform if they betrayed Vlaakith Lae'zel, so this branch should continue on that logic.

270.speaker: Orpheus
270.text: Lae'zel was a talented child, but her talents were misdirected.

501.speaker: Orpheus
501.text: She would have made an exquisite warrior, with proper indoctrination.

344.speaker: Orpheus
344.text: I trust you understand your predicament better than she did? There can be only one honourable conclusion.

516.speaker: Orpheus
516.text: I trust you understand your predicament better than she did? There can be only one honourable conclusion.

428.speaker: Orpheus
428.text: I trust you understand your predicament better than she did? There can be only one honourable conclusion.

279.speaker: Orpheus
279.text: I trust you understand your predicament better than she did? There can be only one honourable conclusion.

131.speaker: Narrator
131.text: *His eyes are unseeing, his voice silenced. But even with his mind caged, you can feel his power.*
131.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Orpheus chained up, unresponsive. (Truncated, without the long shot of the walk in)

221.speaker: Orpheus
221.text: I trust you have weighed your options and reached the only honourable conclusion.
221.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

117.speaker: Orpheus
117.text: I am impressed by your courage.

139.speaker: Orpheus
139.text: The Astral Plane can give you that. But you cannot delay the inevitable forever.

194.speaker: Player
194.text: I will never be a mind flayer.

224.speaker: Orpheus
224.text: Tiefling. The time has come. Are you ready?

233.speaker: Orpheus
233.text: But you are not the ideal candidate for transformation. You may not withstand the process.

409.speaker: Orpheus
409.text: I will consult with your leader - send them to me.

300.speaker: Narrator
300.text: *You can almost taste the fluid beneath his scalp, cushioning that sweet, dense brain, and the power within it.*
300.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

401.speaker: Narrator
401.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

419.speaker: Player
419.text: I see that look, I know that look. Don't you dare.
419.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

423.speaker: Lae'zel
423.text: I see that look, I know that look. Don't you dare.
423.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

278.speaker: Lae'zel
278.text: I see that look, I know that look. If this is how the traitor prince must die, then let it be so!
278.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

228.speaker: Player
228.text: *But this is Prince Orpheus - the saviour of your people. Imprisoned he may be, at least he is alive.*
228.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

402.speaker: Narrator
402.text: *But this is Prince Orpheus - the saviour of your people. Imprisoned he may be, at least he is alive.*
402.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

219.speaker: Narrator
219.text: *You have disappointed your queen, but perhaps eradicating the rebel prince might move you closer to her favour.*
219.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

367.speaker: Player
367.text: Let your illithid instincts flow through into action. Consume Orpheus' brain.
367.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

116.speaker: Lae'zel
116.text: You are gone, you are ghaik, lost to your hunger. I cannot let you suffer -
116.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

518.speaker: Lae'zel
518.text: - but I cannot let you live!

490.speaker: Lae'zel
490.context: InternalNodeContext: Visceral and guttural response, stepping in front of Orpheus

181.speaker: Lae'zel
181.text: Deny your hunger and free Orpheus, or I will bathe this place in your silver blood!

187.speaker: Player
187.text: The craving, the urge. I'm sorry - it's almost more than I can bear.

476.speaker: Lae'zel
476.text: Then you are truly ghaik, from skull to talon.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: You are a fool. Free him, and he's bound to kill us.

400.speaker: Lae'zel
400.text: A true coward's words. Do you trust me so little to think I'd lead you to death's maw?

549.speaker: Player
549.text: We need his power. This is the only way.

153.speaker: Lae'zel
153.text: But it is not. The bargain was made, the path was cleared!

343.speaker: Lae'zel
343.text: And to think - you were the source of my joy. I trusted you.

497.speaker: Lae'zel
497.text: I stand with the Prince of the Comet. Attack, and you perish by my hand.

172.speaker: Player
172.text: You wouldn't dare - I'm too powerful. You need my help to kill the brain.

432.speaker: Lae'zel
432.text: Hells. By the sacred silver, who will lead our people to glory, if not Mother Gith's son?

34.speaker: Lae'zel
34.text: Hells. By the sacred silver, who will lead our people to glory, if not Mother Gith's son?

110.speaker: Player
110.text: A question you can ponder when the Netherbrain's dead.

119.speaker: Lae'zel
119.text: One question of many, I promise you.

398.speaker: Lae'zel
398.text: Do it. Take his mind, and be quick.
398.context: NodeContext: Truly despondent but keeping strong and a bit quiet.

554.speaker: Lae'zel
554.text: When the brain is dead, I go my way - you go yours.
554.context: NodeContext: Truly despondent but keeping strong and a bit quiet.

445.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player mind flayer does a hand wave gesture and removes the globe of domination around Orpheus. 
The Player (as a mind flayer) wraps their tentacles around Orpheus' face and brings their mouth over Orpheus' head. 
Player feeds CLUMSILY. Suckling noises.
Orpheus' eyes dart around in pain as his brain is consumed.
Once it's done, Orpheus' head flops to the side, his head empty.

451.speaker: Player
451.text: The resistance will not die with Orpheus. A new leader will rise.

517.speaker: Lae'zel
517.text: Perhaps. And how many more millennia will we need to wait?

253.speaker: Player
253.text: The Githyanki Empire has a queen already. It'll be fine.

133.speaker: Lae'zel
133.text: Vlaakith, yes. The undying lich, the slaver of the githyanki.

498.speaker: Player
498.text: The empire will thrive under Vlaakith, as it has always done.

136.text: Bah - I'll trust my chances without you. You are weak. You succumbed to temptation.
136.context: NodeContext: zhak vone-fin-DOO, source of my joy. Laezel about to attack her lover.

331.speaker: Lae'zel
331.text: Bah - I'll trust my chances without you. You are weak. You succumbed to temptation.
331.context: NodeContext: zhak vone-fin-DOO, source of my joy. Laezel about to attack her lover.

374.speaker: Lae'zel
374.text: Chk - you made your choice. And I've made mine.
374.context: NodeContext: zhak vone-fin-DOO, source of my joy. Laezel about to attack her lover.

488.speaker: Lae'zel
488.context: NodeContext: zhak vone-fin-DOO, source of my joy. Laezel about to attack her lover.

537.speaker: Player
537.text: You wouldn't dare - I'm too powerful. You need my help to kill the brain.

334.speaker: Player
334.text: Kill me, and the Grand Design will come to pass. Your people will become illithid.

333.speaker: Player
333.text: Kill me, and the Grand Design will come to pass. Your people will become illithid.

323.speaker: Lae'zel
323.text: I will not just stand by while you consume the future of my people.

538.speaker: Player
538.text: You're right. He is not only your prince, he is our best weapon against the brain.

297.speaker: Lae'zel
297.text: Your senses are still intact, then. Unchain the prince. Let the githyanki be free.

232.speaker: Player
232.text: Join me or get out of my way, Lae'zel.

454.speaker: Lae'zel
454.text: Then your choice is made - and so is mine.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Visualise the disgusting reality of your cravings: eating a viscous, bloody brain.

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *Your mind and body whine with disappointment. But your soul lets out a gentle thrum of relief.*

543.speaker: Narrator
543.text: *Your mind and body whine with disappointment. But your soul lets out a gentle thrum of relief.*

348.speaker: Narrator
348.text: *Imprisoned though he may be, Prince Orpheus lives.*

145.text: *Happiness, excitement, and the promise of a good feeding swell within you, eradicating all doubt.*

281.speaker: Narrator
281.text: *Happiness, excitement, and the promise of a good feeding swell within you, eradicating all doubt.*

435.speaker: Player
435.text: Cling to your former nature. Quash your hunger. This is not who you are.

273.speaker: Orpheus
273.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Orpheus chained up, unresponsive.

249.speaker: Orpheus
249.text: I must ask you one more time - must you still insist that I be the one to transform?

373.speaker: Player
373.text: No, I'll do it. I'll become a mind flayer instead of you.

277.speaker: Narrator
277.text: *His eyes are unseeing, his voice silenced. But even with his mind caged, you can feel his power.*
277.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Orpheus chained up, unresponsive.

442.speaker: Orpheus
442.text: I see you found the tadpole. And one of you had honour enough to reconsider your position. Good.
442.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus calmly pulls a shortsword out of the rock nearby - his sword that was placed just out of reach that he's been staring at the whole time he's been imprisoned. He looks threatening.

89.speaker: Orpheus
89.text: To the portal then. We must pursue the Netherbrain.

459.speaker: Narrator
459.text: *As the githyanki prince takes his blade, a silent cry pierces your head. It's unlike any sensation you've ever felt.*
459.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus calmly pulls a shortsword out of the rock nearby - his sword that was placed just out of reach that he's been staring at the whole time he's been imprisoned. He looks threatening.

100.speaker: Orpheus
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus examines the sword as he speaks. Looks at us. NodeContext: Orpheus examines the sword as he speaks. Looks at us.

182.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus examines the sword as he speaks. Looks at us. NodeContext: Orpheus examines the sword as he speaks. Looks at us.

486.speaker: Orpheus
486.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus examines the sword as he speaks. Looks at us. NodeContext: Orpheus examines the sword as he speaks. Looks at us.

239.speaker: Orpheus
239.text: You fornicated with a mind flayer.
239.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus examines the sword as he speaks. Looks at us. NodeContext: Orpheus examines the sword as he speaks. Looks at us.

313.speaker: Orpheus
313.text: And you slaughtered my honour guard.
313.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus examines the sword as he speaks. Looks at us. NodeContext: Orpheus examines the sword as he speaks. Looks at us.

322.speaker: Orpheus
322.text: Nonetheless, it seems we must be allies.
322.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Wilson] Orpheus sheathe the shortsword behind his back and end with a stand forward R.NodeContext: with resignation

8.text: Your Majesty. The Prince of the Comet, Gith's true heir. It is an honour.
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus looks at you with distaste before speaking

168.speaker: Player
168.text: Your Majesty. The Prince of the Comet, Gith's true heir. It is an honour.
168.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus looks at you with distaste before speaking

196.speaker: Lae'zel
196.text: Your Majesty. The Prince of the Comet, Gith's true heir. It is an honour.
196.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus looks at you with distaste before speaking

86.speaker: Player
86.text: You may address me as Your Majesty.
86.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus looks at you with distaste before speaking

560.speaker: Orpheus
560.text: You may address me as Your Majesty.
560.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus looks at you with distaste before speaking

222.speaker: Player
222.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus looks at you with distaste before speaking

276.speaker: Player
276.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus looks at you with distaste before speaking

142.speaker: Player
142.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus looks at you with distaste before speaking

493.speaker: Orpheus
493.text: Make no mistake - were it not for our common goal, I would strangle you where you stand.
493.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus looks at you with distaste before speaking

457.speaker: Orpheus
457.text: Your very existence tests my self-restraint.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: Your Majesty. The Prince of the Comet, Gith's true heir. It is an honour.

183.speaker: Player
183.text: You may address me with a little more courtesy. I freed you.

23.speaker: Orpheus
23.text: You rejected the illithid when it no longer suited your needs. No doubt you freed me because it suits you now.

380.speaker: Orpheus
380.text: I will neither forgive nor forget your abuse of my powers.

236.speaker: Player
236.text: I had no choice. Without your powers, I would have died.

303.speaker: Orpheus
303.text: That is true. And it would have been the honourable outcome for one destined to become ghaik.

369.speaker: Orpheus
369.text: They would have freed me, and I would have stopped the elder brain before it evolved into a Netherbrain.

202.speaker: Player
202.text: The Emperor held all the cards until now. I freed you at the first opportunity.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Drop the attitude. You're free now, aren't you?

92.speaker: Orpheus
92.text: I could have been free much sooner.

39.speaker: Orpheus
39.text: You had the opportunity to surrender yourself to my honour guard. They would have given you a noble end.

36.speaker: Orpheus
36.text: Any worthy individual destined to become ghaik would've done so.

25.speaker: Orpheus
25.text: My guard would have freed me, and I would have stopped the elder brain before it evolved into a Netherbrain.

11.speaker: Orpheus
11.text: All that suffering - avoidable. Were it not for the choices you made.

64.speaker: Player
64.context: NodeContext: Firm/determined - stepping up to the plate

157.speaker: Player
157.context: NodeContext: Firm/determined - stepping up to the plate

241.speaker: Player
241.text: Let's forget about the past. I was misled. What now?
241.context: NodeContext: Firm/determined - stepping up to the plate

350.speaker: Player
350.text: You went through a lot so I'll ignore that. Do you have an idea how to stop the brain?
350.context: NodeContext: Firm/determined - stepping up to the plate

382.speaker: Player
382.text: While we bicker, the Netherbrain is executing the Grand Design. We need to stop it.
382.context: NodeContext: Firm/determined - stepping up to the plate

304.speaker: Orpheus
304.text: ...In this we are aligned. I am obliged to overlook your transgressions.

388.speaker: Orpheus
388.text: We will destroy the Netherbrain together, and put a stop to this nascent Empire before it expands into the stars.

443.speaker: Player
443.text: The queen demands your head. And I mean to take it.
443.context: NodeContext: Firm/determined - stepping up to the plate

337.speaker: Player
337.text: The queen demands your head. And I mean to take it.
337.context: NodeContext: Firm/determined - stepping up to the plate

320.speaker: Orpheus
320.text: Foolish child. You would doom yourself to being the Netherbrain's thrall.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: If that's all you have to say, I'll just leave you here then.
15.context: NodeContext: Firm/determined - stepping up to the plate

45.speaker: Orpheus
45.context: NodeContext: Firm/determined - stepping up to the plate

251.speaker: Orpheus
251.text: The ghaik was correct about one thing - the Netherbrain's power is beyond us.
251.context: NodeContext: Firm/determined - stepping up to the plate

213.speaker: Orpheus
213.text: The hardest metal in the world would not cut through its mind, for it is made of thought itself.
213.context: NodeContext: Firm/determined - stepping up to the plate

307.speaker: Orpheus
307.text: At this point, it will take an illithid to unleash the full potential of the Netherstones.
307.context: NodeContext: Firm/determined - stepping up to the plate

562.speaker: Gale
562.text: And it would take one wizard to unleash a cataclysm powerful enough to tear apart the brain's very being. We have no choice but to consider using the orb.
562.context: NodeContext: Firm/determined - stepping up to the plate

88.speaker: Orpheus
88.text: I do not know you, wizard, and I do not know this 'orb'.

363.speaker: Orpheus
363.text: But what I do know is that we must not gamble with the fate of the world. I cannot simply depend upon your word.

390.speaker: Lae'zel
390.text: I've heard enough. My Queen demands your head. It is time I take it.
390.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus looks down, pensive, sad - a long pause as he thinks about everything he wanted to do, everything he will be leaving behind, just as freedom was beckoning.

289.speaker: Narrator
289.text: *Vlaakith's greatest threat stands before you. But to end him would condemn you and your allies to be the Netherbrain's eternal thralls.*
289.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus looks down, pensive, sad - a long pause as he thinks about everything he wanted to do, everything he will be leaving behind, just as freedom was beckoning.

512.speaker: Player
512.text: Someone will need to turn into a mind flayer. Are you willing to do that?
512.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus looks down, pensive, sad - a long pause as he thinks about everything he wanted to do, everything he will be leaving behind, just as freedom was beckoning.

22.speaker: Orpheus
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus looks down, pensive, sad - a long pause as he thinks about everything he wanted to do, everything he will be leaving behind, just as freedom was beckoning.

341.speaker: Orpheus
341.context: NodeContext: having made up his mind and reached an awful conclusion

111.speaker: Orpheus
111.text: I will become - illithid. I will sacrifice my soul for my people. I will end the Grand Design.
111.context: NodeContext: with firmer resolve but choking on the phrase 'become illithid' - it's his worst nightmare, literally nauseating and devastating to him

492.speaker: Lae'zel
492.text: And yet you will live. A ghaik thrall wearing the skin of his masters at long last.
492.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus puts out his hand. Player gives him the supreme tadpole. Orpheus looks disgusted and uncomfortable.

559.speaker: Orpheus
559.text: Is this what you think? That I am an agent of the Illithid Empire?

510.speaker: Lae'zel
510.text: It is etched in slate. So says Vlaakith, and so it must be.

231.speaker: Lae'zel
231.text: My mission is eternal, immutable. Our path ends here, k'chakhi. On this day, Gith's son shall perish by my hands.

106.speaker: Lae'zel
106.text: My Prince, you cannot. This is not your burden to bear!
106.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus puts out his hand. Player gives him the supreme tadpole. Orpheus looks disgusted and uncomfortable.

546.speaker: Orpheus
546.text: All right, then. You are a true hero.
546.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus puts out his hand. Player gives him the supreme tadpole. Orpheus looks disgusted and uncomfortable.

186.speaker: Player
186.text: All right, then. You are a true hero.
186.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus puts out his hand. Player gives him the supreme tadpole. Orpheus looks disgusted and uncomfortable.

391.speaker: Orpheus
391.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus puts out his hand. Player gives him the supreme tadpole. Orpheus looks disgusted and uncomfortable.

426.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus puts out his hand. Player gives him the supreme tadpole. Orpheus looks disgusted and uncomfortable.

521.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus |uses| the supreme tadpole and begins the Illithid transformation, which continues over the next nodes.

263.speaker: Player
263.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus speaks while transforming into an Illithid.

284.speaker: Lae'zel
284.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus speaks while transforming into an Illithid.

205.speaker: Player
205.text: Even in my darkest hours, I knew it was my destiny to save my people - I could never have imagined this would be the way.
205.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus speaks while transforming into an Illithid.

422.speaker: Orpheus
422.text: Even in my darkest hours, I knew it was my destiny to save my people - I could never have imagined this would be the way.
422.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus speaks while transforming into an Illithid.

483.speaker: Orpheus
483.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus lifts his head to the stars, utters a prayer, and becomes full Illithid. NodeContext: 'Gith's light guides us' (Gith is his mother and the founder of all githyanki) [GITH-ka TAHV-keem KRASH-ht]

561.context: CinematicNodeContext: Transformation over. Orpheus is Illithid and speaks telepathically now (like the Emperor.) The stones float over into his grasp. He looks at them with dismay for a beat before the next line.

456.speaker: Orpheus
456.context: CinematicNodeContext: Transformation over. Orpheus is Illithid and speaks telepathically now (like the Emperor.) The stones float over into his grasp. He looks at them with dismay for a beat before the next line.

126.speaker: Orpheus
126.text: Let us seek out the Netherbrain and finish this.

258.speaker: Orpheus
258.text: Once the Grand Design is ended, kill me. It is the very least you can do.

496.speaker: Orpheus
496.text: Is this some sort of trick, or are you really so careless as to have misplaced it?
496.context: NodeContext: g'lyck - 'geh-LIK' - githyanki sigh. k'chakhi - 'ke-CHOCK-ee' - idiots. Muttered to himself about the player, who he now considers an absolute imbecile.

3.speaker: Orpheus
3.text: G'lyck. Cursed to be in the presence of k'chakhi.
3.context: NodeContext: g'lyck - 'geh-LIK' - githyanki sigh. k'chakhi - 'ke-CHOCK-ee' - idiots. Muttered to himself about the player, who he now considers an absolute imbecile.

204.speaker: Orpheus
204.text: It seems that someone else took the responsibility that you could not. There is at least some honour amongst your ranks.

447.speaker: Orpheus
447.text: There is no more for us to discuss.

295.speaker: Player
295.text: All right, then. Take the tadpole the Emperor gave.
295.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus brings his right hand to his temple on "pleased", looking down and pausing a beat, before dropping his hand and finishing the line.NodeContext: with bitter hatred of what he's about to do, even though he knows it's a noble sacrifice

446.speaker: Player
446.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus brings his right hand to his temple on "pleased", looking down and pausing a beat, before dropping his hand and finishing the line.NodeContext: with bitter hatred of what he's about to do, even though he knows it's a noble sacrifice

161.speaker: Orpheus
161.text: The Netherbrain will be only too pleased to claim me...
161.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus brings his right hand to his temple on "pleased", looking down and pausing a beat, before dropping his hand and finishing the line.NodeContext: with bitter hatred of what he's about to do, even though he knows it's a noble sacrifice

408.speaker: Player
408.text: Keep your soul - your people need you. I will make the sacrifice.

67.speaker: Lae'zel
67.text: Vlaakith's mission is eternal, immutable. Our path ends here. On this day, Gith's son shall perish by my hands.

397.speaker: Player
397.text: Respond with the tadpole. 'We need Orpheus' protection. You can kill him when the Netherbrain's dead. I promise.'

93.speaker: Narrator
93.text: *A moment passes - and you feel Lae'zel relent.*

73.speaker: Lae'zel
73.text: Orpheus, rotten seed of great Mother Gith, shame of the Empire.

290.speaker: Lae'zel
290.text: No sight makes me sicker, no name kindles such rage.

485.speaker: Lae'zel
485.text: If I'm to end the Netherbrain and its Grand Design, it seems I must call you ally. But I will never call you my prince.

267.speaker: Orpheus
267.text: Then we've nothing to discuss, disciple of Vlaakith.

475.speaker: Orpheus
475.text: But you? You I've misjudged. You were testing my honour. And in so doing, you have convinced me of yours.

506.speaker: Orpheus
506.text: Instead, witness the sight of true sacrifice.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Kill Orpheus, and you hand victory to the brain. Is that what you want?

508.speaker: Lae'zel
508.text: Vlaakith will not let the Grand Design come to pass! In the Undying Queen, the githyanki are eternal.

547.speaker: Player
547.text: You've left me no choice, Lae'zel. I'm striking you down.

292.speaker: Lae'zel
292.text: Tsk'va! I see only vermin before me, primed for extermination. Orpheus will not be the only traitor to die this day.

265.speaker: Lae'zel
265.text: Let the histories show: Lae'zel of K'liir shattered the Prince of the Comet!

479.speaker: Player
479.text: I am with you, Lae'zel. Today, Orpheus dies.

530.speaker: Orpheus
530.text: Slay me then if you can, in the knowledge that if you win, the Netherbrain will take your mind.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: You have given too much already. I will be illithid, I will bear the burden.
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus descends to one knee in respect to whichever player is the mind flayer.

328.speaker: Orpheus
328.text: It seems I misjudged  you. You were testing my honour. And in so doing, you have convinced me of yours.
328.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus descends to one knee in respect to whichever player is the mind flayer.

81.speaker: Orpheus
81.text: When the moment of transformation comes, you will be the one ghaik I salute instead of slaughter.
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus descends to one knee in respect to whichever player is the mind flayer.

417.speaker: Orpheus
417.text: My people will remember you, tiefling - the rebel illithid who stood beside their reborn prince and ended the Grand Design.
417.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus descends to one knee in respect to whichever player is the mind flayer.

54.speaker: Orpheus
54.text: My people will remember you - the rebel illithid who stood beside their reborn prince and ended the Grand Design.
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus descends to one knee in respect to whichever player is the mind flayer.

524.speaker: Orpheus
524.text: Let us return now to the city, and follow the path of the Netherbrain.

507.speaker: Player
507.text: So be it. But when the Grand Design is ended, I need the stones back.

188.speaker: Orpheus
188.text: As you wish. They will be useless once they've served their purpose.

379.speaker: Player
379.text: There has to be another way.
379.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

550.speaker: Orpheus
550.text: We face a Netherbrain. For there to be one way to defeat it is unlikely enough. There will not be another.

449.speaker: Player
449.text: I'm not becoming a mind flayer.
449.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

520.speaker: Orpheus
520.text: Wait. Maybe you don't have to. It... it should be me.
520.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

418.speaker: Orpheus
418.text: Wait. Maybe you don't have to. It... it should be me.
418.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

471.speaker: Karlach
471.text: Wait. Maybe you don't have to. It... it should be me.
471.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

14.speaker: Player
14.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

396.speaker: Karlach
396.text: I'm dying. My heart feels like a live grenade - gonna blow any minute. You still have a life to live. I don't.

364.speaker: Player
364.text: This is my sacrifice to make. Not yours.
364.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

72.speaker: Player
72.text: This isn't your sacrifice to make.
72.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

371.speaker: Karlach
371.text: But it isn't a sacrifice. Not to me. I... I'm dying. This thing in my chest is burning me through.
371.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

394.speaker: Karlach
394.text: If this is the end for me, let me be the motherfucker who saved the world.
394.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

98.speaker: Player
98.text: If this is what you really want, all I can say is thank you.
98.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

68.speaker: Karlach
68.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

410.speaker: Orpheus
410.text: You. Tiefling. You would volunteer your life for the greater good. You would make the ultimate sacrifice. I thank you.
410.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

340.speaker: Orpheus
340.text: The Netherbrain wants nothing more than to see all infected become ghaik.
340.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

389.speaker: Orpheus
389.text: My defences keep the voice of the Absolute out, but just as I can raise them, so I can lower them.
389.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

178.speaker: Orpheus
178.text: I will allow the voice of the Absolute in. Once it reaches you, it will order you to transform.
178.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

271.speaker: Orpheus
271.text: It will only take a moment. And once you are a mind flayer, I will fold you under my protection once more.
271.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

40.speaker: Narrator
40.text: *With the withdrawal of Orpheus' power, Karlach's mind is rushed with the full force of the Netherbrain.*
40.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus puts two fingers to his temple.
Karlach is suddenly overcome.

102.speaker: Narrator
102.text: *The very fabric of her being is torn apart and reformed in an agonising process that is over all too soon.*
102.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach, in excruciating pain and ecstasy, transforms into a mind flayer. (Like gameplay animation, but more cinematic.)

275.speaker: Narrator
275.text: *Then - stillness as she stands transformed, once again closed off from the Netherbrain's mind.*
275.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach stands there as a mind flayer.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: No, Karlach. This is for me to do. I'll embrace the parasite - I'll evolve.
26.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

429.speaker: Orpheus

124.speaker: Player
124.text: No - neither of us is turning into a mind flayer. Not now.

532.speaker: Karlach
532.text: You always were sensible. This heart inside me is about to blow. Doesn't matter which body it obliterates, right?

216.speaker: Karlach
216.text: Look, my offer is still on the table. I can do this. I should do this. You know you can trust me.
216.context: NodeContext: A major moment. A major offer. A major sacrifice.

385.speaker: Player
385.text: Our people's future is at stake. I'll do as you say.
385.context: InternalNodeContext: For multiplayer, so if Sally is the speaker, but Bob wants to transform.

404.speaker: Player
404.text: I understand. If that's what it takes, I'll do it.
404.context: InternalNodeContext: For multiplayer, so if Sally is the speaker, but Bob wants to transform.

319.speaker: Player
319.text: I understand. If that's what it takes, I'll do it.
319.context: InternalNodeContext: For multiplayer, so if Sally is the speaker, but Bob wants to transform.

112.speaker: Orpheus
112.text: There is honour within you yet. I commend this.

190.speaker: Orpheus
190.text: There is honour within you yet. I commend this.

424.speaker: Player
424.text: I trust in Gale. You have my word.
424.context: InternalNodeContext: For multiplayer, so if Sally is the speaker, but Bob wants to transform.

383.speaker: Orpheus
383.text: Your word means as little to me as his.

342.speaker: Orpheus
342.text: He may destroy himself when the time comes, if he so chooses, I will have my assurances now.

46.speaker: Orpheus
46.text: But I am fortunate... It seems that someone already took the responsibility that you could not. There is at least some honour amongst your ranks.

130.speaker: Orpheus
130.text: One of us must transform, and we must do it right away.

252.speaker: Player
252.text: This isn't an easy decision. I need a moment to consider it.
252.context: InternalNodeContext: For multiplayer, so if Sally is the speaker, but Bob wants to transform.

327.speaker: Orpheus
327.text: Consider, yes, but know that it is not your burden to bear - the weight of it would crush you.
327.context: NodeContext: 'It always is' muttered under his breath - he's talking about himself there

242.speaker: Orpheus
242.text: It is your leader who must make the choice. It always is.
242.context: NodeContext: 'It always is' muttered under his breath - he's talking about himself there

218.speaker: Orpheus
218.text: Consider, yes. But know that the answer is already foretold. This is the only way to stop the Grand Design.

406.speaker: Orpheus
406.text: Whatever prevents you from doing what is necessary - face it, overcome it.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: You are a threat to the githyanki order. Prepare for battle, traitor.

415.speaker: Orpheus
415.text: If you kill me, it will be the end of you. And everything else. The Netherbrain will restore the Illithid Empire. Is that truly what you want?

368.speaker: Player
368.text: *You realise he is telling the truth. If you kill him, you are dooming everyone.*

452.text: *You realise he is telling the truth. If you kill him, you are dooming everyone.*

201.speaker: Narrator
201.text: *You realise he is telling the truth. If you kill him, you are dooming everyone.*

164.speaker: Player
164.text: All right. Allies it is then.

533.speaker: Lae'zel
533.text: Allies? Shka'keth! I will hear no more of this nonsense.

5.speaker: Orpheus
5.text: It seems I misjudged you. You are capable of sacrifice.

237.speaker: Orpheus
237.text: Then you would condemn us all to the Grand Design.

65.speaker: Orpheus
65.text: You must reconsider - this is the only way.

200.speaker: Orpheus
200.text: Overcome whatever prevents you from doing the only thing that will guarantee your survival.

189.speaker: Orpheus
189.text: Return to me when you are ready to transform.

173.speaker: Player
173.text: No more lies, traitor. You will not deny me my ascension.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: That will not be necessary. I can destroy the brain with a single spell - though it would kill me too.

515.speaker: Orpheus
515.text: An honourable offer - to sacrifice yourself to save the world.

266.speaker: Orpheus
266.text: But I do not know you, and the fate of the world cannot depend upon your word.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: I should have left you in your chains.

148.speaker: Orpheus
148.text: And you should have surrendered yourself to my honour guard. They would have given you a noble end.

256.speaker: Player
256.text: I only freed you so that I could kill you.

542.speaker: Player
542.text: Your honour guard attacked me. What was I supposed to do?

50.speaker: Orpheus
50.text: You should have yielded to them. They would have given you a noble end.

411.speaker: Player
411.text: The Undying Queen demands your head. I have come to take it.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: The Undying Queen demands your head. I have come to take it.

255.speaker: Player
255.text: The traitor prince. Vlaakith's would-be usurper.

505.speaker: Lae'zel
505.text: The traitor prince. Vlaakith's would-be usurper.

286.speaker: Lae'zel
286.text: Speaking with him is pointless. He knows only the language of ghaik heresy.

545.speaker: Orpheus
545.text: You stole an unborn hatchling from my people.

357.speaker: Orpheus
357.text: You took advantage of my powers.

465.speaker: Orpheus
465.text: I see you found it. And you had honour enough to use it. My people will thank you.
465.context: NodeContext: Mind flayer - abomination to Vlaakith!

487.speaker: Orpheus
487.text: The heretic child lives. Execute her as you said you would - then, we shall speak.
487.context: NodeContext: Mind flayer - abomination to Vlaakith!

491.speaker: Orpheus
491.context: NodeContext: Mind flayer - abomination to Vlaakith!

413.speaker: Orpheus
413.text: You. Friend of ghaik. Ally of my abuser. You will face my retribution.

513.speaker: Narrator
513.text: *The hunger is too much to bear. Your nature is irresistible.*
513.context: NodeContext: A major moment. A major offer. A major sacrifice.

522.speaker: Orpheus
522.text: But perhaps you can still redeem yourself. And I may yet fulfil my destiny.
522.context: NodeContext: A major moment. A major offer. A major sacrifice.

6.speaker: Orpheus
6.text: But perhaps you can still redeem yourself. And I may yet fulfil my destiny.
6.context: NodeContext: A major moment. A major offer. A major sacrifice.

235.speaker: Player
235.text: Please - whatever Prince Orpheus asks of us, we must obey.

557.speaker: Lae'zel
557.text: Please - whatever Prince Orpheus asks of us, we must obey.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: Chk. The traitor's destiny is to adorn my queen's throne as a trophy.

463.speaker: Lae'zel
463.text: Chk. The traitor's destiny is to adorn my queen's throne as a trophy.

254.speaker: Orpheus
254.text: It is you who must transform.
254.context: NodeContext: A major moment. A major offer. A major sacrifice.

203.speaker: Player
203.text: I'm not long for this world. It makes sense that it should be me.

246.speaker: Orpheus
246.text: Then you would condemn us all to the Grand Design. Fortunately, you are not the one in control.

336.speaker: Orpheus
336.text: You have no honour. And no sense. Even if I wanted to, I could not become a mind flayer. You are the one with the parasite in your head.
336.context: NodeContext: A major moment. A major offer. A major sacrifice.

468.speaker: Karlach
468.text: Well. And me. Look, I'm not long for this world anyway. I should transform. Do what needs to be done.
468.context: NodeContext: A major moment. A major offer. A major sacrifice.

450.speaker: Orpheus
450.text: Since you drove the mind flayer away, you will need to become illithid in its place.

362.speaker: Orpheus
362.text: This should not be too big a sacrifice for you. You are already halfway there.

82.speaker: Orpheus
82.text: It's understandable that you've been resisting the prospect, but it is how you will earn your redemption.

539.speaker: Orpheus
539.text: You understand nothing of duty, nor sacrifice.

381.speaker: Lae'zel
381.text: Enough of this. We take his head here and now.

354.speaker: Orpheus
354.text: Fool. The moment I fall, the Netherbrain takes you. Under my terms, you may be illithid - but your mind will be yours.

529.speaker: Orpheus
529.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Orpheus chained up, unresponsive. Same as N433.

541.speaker: Orpheus
541.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Orpheus chained up, unresponsive. Same as N433.

551.speaker: Narrator
551.text: *You may have resisted once, but your hunger remains unsated. And this is a truly fine specimen. Best not to tempt fate.*
551.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Orpheus chained up, unresponsive. Same as N433.
